meanings.definition: The quality or state of being washable.
meanings.sent1: The washabilities of the fabric make it easy to clean.
meanings.sent2: I always check the washabilities of my clothes before buying them.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape had incredible washabilities, staying spotless even after battles.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a washabilities that made everyone feel comfortable around her.
meanings.sent5: The new detergent advertised its washabilities, promising to remove tough stains.

meanings.definition: The ability to be washed without damage.
meanings.sent1: The delicate washabilities of the silk scarf require handwashing.
meanings.sent2: The durability of the toy's washabilities impressed the parents.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's chew toy had impressive washabilities, surviving many wash cycles.
meanings.sent4: His patience had a washabilities that withstood life's challenges.
meanings.sent5: The antique vase's washabilities allowed it to be passed down through generations.
